document.masterDocTitle: A new species and first record of Cotinis Burmeister (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Cetoniinae) for Venezuela

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species and first record of Cotinis Burmeister (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Cetoniinae) for Venezuela

heading.emphasis:
Key to the species of adult
Cotinis

subSubSection.paragraph:
(modified from
Goodrich 1966
and
Deloya et al . 2000
)

paragraph.keyLead: - Frontal process developed, with the apical portion free, partially free, or entirely fused to the head..................... 3

2 . Surface of pronotum strongly punctate, punctures bearing short, thick, golden setae. Metafemora simple......................................................................................................
C. boylei Goodrich

- Surface of pronotum punctate; thick, golden setae absent. Metafemora with a distinct notch immediately adjacent to tibial articulation.............................................................................
C. producta Bates

3 . Frontal projection free for its entire length, sides convergent apically (subgenus
Liberocera
)...
C. ibarrai Deloya & Ratcliffe
4 . Dorsum shiny, opaque, velvety, or pruinose-like; venter glossy. Body coloration variable............................. 5

- Dorsum and venter shiny, smooth (in
C. antonii
dorsal surface is not smooth). Body coloration dark................... 24
5 . Frontal projection fused. Clypeal projection large or reduced................................................... 6
- Frontal projection partially free, never fused. Clypeal projection large........................................... 14
- Clypeal projection reduced. Elytra smooth or finely punctate.................................................. 10

7 . Frontal projection short, no more than 50 % of length from vertex to apex of clypeus.................
C. pueblensis Bates
- Frontal projection long, at least 55 % of length from vertex to clypeal apex........................................ 8

8 . Clypeal projection triangular..........................................................
C. pauperula Burmeister
- Clypeal projection semi-trapezoidal or trapezoidal........................................................... 9

9 . Clypeal projection semi-trapezoidal. Pronotum and elytra blackish green, elytra punctatostriate........
C. pokornyi Deloya

- Clypeal projection trapezoidal. Pronotum ashy-brown with green reflections; each elytron with 2 green spots..............................................................................
C. sinitoc Deloya, Ibañez-Bernal
, & Nogueira
10 . Body with velvet-like appearance, surface of pronotum and elytra opaque........................................ 11
- Body glabrous, surface of pronotum and elytra shiny........................................................ 12

11 . Frontal projection long, at least 60 % of length from vertex to clypeal apex, extending beneath antennal insertion.................................................................................................. ..
C. impia (Fall)

- Frontal projection short, no more than 50 % of length from vertex clypeal apex.....................
C. rufipennis Bates

12 . Clypeal projection reduced, uniform, triangular in shape. Pronotum finely punctate, micropunctate on disc. Pygidium opaque, smooth...........................................................................
C. columbica Burmeister

- Clypeal projection reduced, short, broad. Pronotum strongly punctate, punctures much coarser and denser laterally. Pygidium glossy, transversely rugose............................................................................. 13

13 . Clypeal projection bilobed at middle. Ventral pubescence reddish yellow..............................
C. olivia Bates

- Clypeal projection indistinct. Ventral pubescence dark............................................
C. polita Janson
14 . Clypeal projection narrow, less than 0.5 mm thick in lateral view............................................... 15
- Clypeal projection distinctly thickened, greater than 0.5 mm in lateral view....................................... 22

16 . Elytra punctatostriate, punctures glossy and C-shaped. Elytral carinae visible...................
C. punctatostriata Bates

- Elytra punctate, punctures glossy, round. Elytral carinae prominent, more elevated..................
C. aliena Woodruff

17 . Clypeal projection quadrate, rectangular, triangular, or expanded apically. Pygidium unicolorous. Ventral coloration green or red-dark............................................................................................ 18

- Clypeal projection triangular. Pygidium bicolored, apical portion testaceous, basal portion green. Ventral coloration orange.......................................................................................
C. nitida (Linnaeus)
18 . Clypeal projection quadrate, rectangular, triangular, or with sides slightly divergent apically......................... 19

- Clypeal projection with sides strongly divergent apically (inverted trapezoid).......................
C. beraudi Delgado
19 . Pronotum and disc of pronotum smooth or with fine, indistinct punctures........................................ 20
- Pronotum sparsely punctate on disc, punctures becoming much larger and more numerous laterally................... 21

20 . Apex of parameres rounded. Internal sac with 2 spiniform setae. Dorsal coloration variable: green, glossy green, green with orange, black, or black with orange..............................................
C. mutabilis (Gory & Percheron)

- Apex of parameres slightly rounded. Internal sac with a single spiniform seta. Dorsal coloration green with red-black on lateral margin of elytra........................................................................
C. lemoulti Antoine

21 . Clypeal projection right-angled from plane of disc in lateral view. Frontal projection at least 50 % fused to head. Surface of pro- notum opaque............................................................
C. barthelemyi (Gory & Percheron)

- Clypeal projection obtusely angled from plane of disc in lateral view. Frontal projection at least 80 % fused to head. Surface of pronotum glossy........................................
C. patricialvarezae Gasca-Álvarez & Deloya
new species
22 . Frontal projection with apex abruptly expanded and rounded. Clypeal projection variable, apex rounded................ 23

- Frontal projection with apex pointed in dorsal view. Clypeal projection with sides divergent apically, apex weakly tridentate.......................................................................................
C. laticornis Bates

23 . Clypeal projection semicircular. Surface of clypeus with longitudinal ridge between 2 depressions. Dorsal coloration shiny green.....................................................................
C. sphyracera Deloya & Ratcliffe

- Clypeal projection triangular. Surface of clypeus without depressions. Dorsal coloration shiny violet..................................................................................................
C. lebasi (Gory & Percheron)

24 . Frontal projection completely fused, short, not reaching antennal insertion. Clypeal projection reduced to 2 lobes.................................................................................................
C. antonii Dugés
- Frontal projection partially free, extending beyond insertion of antenna. Clypeal projection variable................... 25

25 . Metasternum with long setae, greater than 0.5 mm in length...........................
C. orientalis Deloya & Ratcliffe
- Metasternum with short setae, less than 0.5 mm in length..................................................... 26

26 . Clypeal projection right-angled from plane of disc in lateral view. Elytra with 2 well-developed costae...................................................................................................
C. viridicyanea (Perbosc)
- Clypeal projection obtusely angled from plane of disc in lateral view. Elytra lacking costae.......................... 27

27 . Color brownish black or deep plum. Internal sac of male genitalia with large teeth, greater than 0.5 mm in length.............................................................................................
C. fuscopicea Goodrich

- Color variable, blue to bluish green to purple. Internal sac of male genitalia with small teeth, less than 0.5 mm .....................................................................................
C. subviolacea Deloya & Ratcliffe
